column2: The Culdees in Insular Christianity lead an ascetic life, finding purpose in prayer as well as work, often in the name of aiding their fellow men and women. A lay member of the Order is not required to take on the life of a hermit – instead focus should be placed on helping the members of your community.
column3: Les Culdee de la Chétienté insulaire mènent une vie ascétique, trouvant un but dans la prière aussi bien que dans le travail, souvent pour aider leurs semblables. Un membre lai de l'Ordre n'est pas tenu de vivre en ermite, mais l'accent devrait alors être mis sur l'aide aux membres de la communauté.
column4: Die Anhänger des Heiligen Basilius führen ein asketisches Leben und finden Erfüllung im Gebet und in der Arbeit, die oft dazu dient, ihren Mitmenschen zu helfen. Ein Laienmitglied des Ordens ist nicht dazu verpflichtet, ein Einsiedlerleben zu führen. Ihr solltet Euch stattdessen darauf konzentrieren, den Mitgliedern Eurer Gemeinde zu helfen.
column6: Los seguidores de san Basilio llevan vidas de ascetismo y se dedican a la oración y al trabajo, a menudo en nombre de la ayuda a sus semejantes. A los miembros novatos de la orden no se les exige que adopten la vida ermitaña, sino que se centren en ayudar a los miembros de su comunidad.

column2: Hidden Jewish communities have organized under oppression ever since the Babylonian captivity. This is not the first time Jews have been forced underground, nor will it be the last. Hated by the orthodox Jewish community and mocked by the Christians, whom Ebionites view as tainted by Paul to reject the Law, the Ebionites claim to stand alone as the true Children of Israel. Yeshua promised a restored Israel, and while He laid the groundwork, the Ebionites claim they are the ones to enact His Will. For now, they do it in silence, spreading the message of the Lord to all who are willing to listen.
column3: Les communautés juives cachées se sont organisées sous l'oppression depuis la captivité babylonienne. Ce n'est pas la première fois que les juifs ont été forcés à la clandestinité et ce ne sera pas la dernière. Détestés par la communauté juive orthodoxe et raillés par les chrétiens, que les ébionites considèrent comme souillés par Paul pour rejeter la Loi, les ébionites prétendent être les seuls véritables enfants d'Israël. Yeshoua a promis un Israël restauré, et tandis qu'il préparait le terrain, les ébionites prétendent qu'ils sont ceux qui vont promulguer Sa Volonté. Pour le moment, ils le font en silence, répandant le message du Seigneur à tous ceux qui sont prêts à écouter.
Se convertir secrètement à la religion aquiléenne

Communauté secrète du culte solaire africain
Communauté secrète du culte solaire latin

column2: In secret, Aquileian faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles aquiléens se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: Follows one of the Berber faiths
Follows the local religious traditions of Arabia
Follows the autochtonous traditions of the Balkan peoples.
Follows the local religious traditions of Manipur.
Has liege or vassal of a traditional Berber faith

A warband consisting of warriors following the traditional Berber faiths that worship Gurzil and other local deities. Powerful followers of Gurzil will be able summon large contingents of raiders to aid them against their enemies, as legendary Berber leaders did against the Romans and Arabs historically.
Has not already summoned Gurzil Fanatics
Summon fanatics of Gurzil, Lord of War, to aid you in battle!
Fanatics of Gurzil and other Berber raiders heed the call to war and will aid you in battle!
Summon fanatics of Gurzil to aid you in battle.
Has liege or vassal who follows Enlil

The former Assyrian Empire lay in tatters, the statues of its gods shattered with the power of its rulers. And yet hidden amongst the remaining faithful are warriors of Enlil, vanguards ready to fight and create a new order in the world that has stopped making sense. Grab the sword, rise above your doomed faith, and save the world.
Has not already summoned Enlil's Chosen

They said that Enlil disappeared with the shattering of his idols, yet his followers have continued to trudge on and build a better future. Indeed, these warriors will defend what you have built against the infidel with all their might!
The Chosen of Enlil heed the call to war and will aid you in battle!
Summon Chosen of Enlil to aid you in battle.
Has liege or vassal following the local religious traditions of the Arabian peninsula.
Desert Warriors retreat and train in the great sands of Arabia, Syria, and beyond. There they hone their skills in battle and traditional skills including poetry, falconry, and archery.
Go to the desert and learn the ancient skills of our people: poetry and falconry.
Has not already trained in desert
Has liege or vassal of Balkan religion.

From raiders to mercenaries to several emperors of Rome, warriors trained in the rugged mountains of the Balkans have long proven themselves capable fighters. These warriors, embracing the Serpent as their totem, follow in the warrior traditions of their forefathers.
Summon guerrillas from the highlands to face our enemies in battle.
Has liege or vassal of the vasconic faith.
Has liege or vassal of the Root West religion.
Has a liege or vassal of the Sanamahi faith.
Has a liege or vassal of the Armazi faith.
Has a liege or vassal of the Dravidian faith.
Has a liege or vassal of the Droenmat faith.

Great heroes who died protecting their people are worshipped as Aiyannars, hero deities, by their local villages. These warriors are the greatest of the Dravidian peoples, carrying within them the potential for honor, bravery, and even apotheosis as Aiyannars themselves one day.

Deep in the highlands of the Caucasus train the champions of Armazi and other local deities, reading themselves to defend their people. With the fury of wolves, they descend from the highlands to protect their brothers and defeat the infidels in battle.
Ema Panthoibi is the deity of war, and those who honor her name are blessed in battle. These are the strongest warriors of the Sanamahi faith, ready to defend Manipur and beyond from the infidel!
The descendants of the heavenly white crane remain ready to defend their sacred lands from all who may trample on them.
Their deities may reign in the Underworld, but Sugaar's chosen bring the storm to the nonbelievers as they fight for traditional Vasconic beliefs.

Hawbas, the moon deity, blesses these fighters who train in the dead of night to protect their brothers against the onslaught of Christianity and other infidel faiths. They are skilled in the building of Axumite fortifications, a skill that would be shared with the Christian Nubians and Axumites that would succeed their influence in the religion against the later Arab invasions.
